items.title: In Police Youth Program, Abuse Often Starts When Officers Are Alone With Teens in Cars
items.description: A quarter of sexual misconduct allegations in law enforcement Explorers programs involve officers grooming or abusing young people during ride-alongs.

items.title: From Surveillance to Robot Guards: How AI Could Reshape Prison Life
items.description: Critics worry about opaque data collection, privacy violations and the technology’s bias spreading in jails and prisons.

items.title: ‘Zombie Prisons’: How ICE Detention Is Raising Troubling Facilities From the Dead
items.description: ICE needs more detention space, and it’s faster to open old facilities than to build new ones.

items.title: Cuyahoga County Deputy Involved in Fatal Chases Accused of ‘Lying’ in Hiring Process
items.description: Deputy Kasey Loudermilk lied and kept details off his application about other police forces disqualifying him, according to his personnel file.

items.title: The Marshall Project Names Jennifer Peter New Editor-in-Chief
items.description: Peter, of The Boston Globe, will lead the national criminal justice outlet’s news operations.
